translationTemplates.TranslationTemplate: The testing of basic functionalities of the service failed and therefore all other test cases are skipped. Check all failed Test Cases in the 'Initialization and basic checks' module and ensure that the endpoints for GetCapabilities, GetFeature and DescribeFeatureType operations are accessible from outside your organization.

Expected a response but the service did not return any data. Verify that the used endpoint URL is correct and accessible from outside your organization. If the service requires authentication, then check that the correct credentials are used by the validator or verify that upstream firewalls/proxy servers do not prevent access.

Expected a XML response but the service returned unparsable data. Verify that the used endpoint URL is correct and accessible from outside your organization. If the service requires authentication, then check that the correct credentials are used by the validator or verify that upstream firewalls/proxy servers do not prevent access.

Expected a XML response but the service returned unparsable data with illegal characters before the XML prolog. This is an excerpt of the XML prolog, showing the first 6 characters (invalid characters may have either been hidden by the browser or are replaced with '?'): '{prolog}'. Please note that some tools, such as some browsers, do not show all special characters or report an error!

Expected a XML response but the service returned a HTML page. Verify that the used endpoint URL is correct and accessible from outside your organization. If the service requires authentication and returned an authentication page, then check that the correct credentials are used by the validator or verify that upstream firewalls/proxy servers do not prevent access.
No Output Formats were found in the Capabilities.
The xsi:schemaLocation ' {url} ' can not be accessed, server returned HTTP response code {code}.
The xsi:schemaLocation ' {url} ' is not an HTTP URL.
An error occurred while analyzing the application schema: ' {message} '.
An error occurred while analyzing the application schema (OutputFormat ' {format} ') : ' {message} '.
' {url} ' is not an HTTP URL.
The expected node '{element}' was not found in the response. XPath: {xpath}
'{element}' was NOT expected in the response. XPath: {xpath}
'{elements}' were not expected in the response. XPath: {xpath}
Expected the value '{expected}' instead of '{actual}' in {element}. XPath: {xpath}
Expected a non-empty text value for '{element}'. XPath: {xpath}
Expected a node '{element}' set to '{value}' but it was not found in the response. XPath: {xpath}
A node '{elementName}' with the value '{value}' was NOT expected in the response. XPath: {xpath}

The service returned an unexpected exception: '{text}'. Check the request parameters, which are partially determined from the Capabilities, previous requests or other metadata. Ensure that the service supports the data and functionalities published in the Capabilities and ensure that referenced data exist.
Internal error in the Executable Test Suite. Please contact a system administrator. Error information: {text}
The required response of the test step '{testStepName}' can not be used for this test, due to not well-formed XML has been returned.
The required response of the test step '{testStepName}' can not be used for this test, due to an exception report has been returned.
The required response of the test step '{testStepName}' can not be used for this test, due to no data has been returned.
The test compares data from this response with data from another test step, however the node '{element}' could not be found or has an empty value in test step '{testStepName}'.

The Capabilities do not contain a xsi:schemaLocation with the INSPIRE Download Services schema 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/schemas/inspire_dls/1.0/inspire_dls.xsd' or at least a schema path ending with 'inspire_dls.xsd. Check the Capabilities document.
The schema attribute 'xsi:schemaLocation' was not found in the XML root element of the response. The response cannot be validated.
DescribeStoredQueries response does not contain at least one StoredQuery with the parameters 'CRS', 'DataSetID' , 'DataSetIdNamespace', 'Language', to download the entire INSPIRE dataset.

The MD_identifier '{id}' is found in the metadata document but does not exist in the service Metadata. The service metadata refers to these identifiers: '{datasetIdentifiersList}'. Check the Service Metadata and the Metadata document.
The fileIdentifier does not exist in the service metadata. Check the Metadata document.'
The referred dataset Metadata document does not seem to be ISO Metadata. It does not have an XML element gmd:Metadata. Check the MetadataURL listed in the Capabilities and the Metadata document.
The referred Metadata Record does not seem to be ISO Metadata. It does not have an XML gmd:MD_Metadata root element. Check the response.
The referred Metadata Record does have a Resource Locator (gml:linkage element). Check the response.
The INSPIRE keyword infoFeatureAccessService is not advertized in the Capabilities. Check the INSPIRE ExtendedCapabilities.
{element} is not set in the Capabilities. Check the Capabilities for the OWS element.
No FeatureType found in the Capabilities. Check the Capabilities and configure the service to list at least one FeatureType.
No OutputFormat found in the Capabilities. Check the Capabilities and configure the service to list at least one OutputFormat.
The namespace prefix of FeatureType {value} can not be resolved. Check the namespaces and prefixes in the Capabilities.
List of FeatureTypes, that do not possess the required MetadataURL element: {name}.
List of FeatureTypes, that do not possess the required WGS84BoundingBox element: {name}.
The metadata of the WFS does not contain any coupled resource (srv:operatesOn)

There is at least one element srv:operatesOn in the metadata of the WFS that does not refer to a metadata document as the xlink:href attribute does not exist or is empty. Check the Metadata document."
INSPIRE element '{element}' is missing in the Capabilities. XPath: {xpath} . Check the INSPIRE ExtendedCapabilities.
INSPIRE {name} must be set to '{value}'. Check the INSPIRE ExtendedCapabilities.
The response does not have a WFS 'FeatureCollection' root element.
The response does not have a 'WFS_Capabilities' root element.
The response does not have a 'DescribeStoredQueriesResponse' root element.
The absent inspire_dls:SpatialDataSetIdentifier/inspire_common:Namespace element is declared optional in the schema, however it is a mandatory element in the ExtendedCapabilities.
The recommended identifier 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/operation/download/GetSpatialDataSet', which should be used for serving pre-defined Spatial Data Sets, was not found.
Expected a response in Coordinate Reference System '{expected}' but a response in CRS '{value}' was returned by the service.
There response does not have a XML 'schema' root element.
There response does not have an Atom 'feed' root element.
The response does not have an Open Search 'OpenSearchDescription' root element.
The response does not have at least one Open Search Description URL.
The response does not have at least one Open Search Description Language.
The Open Search Description does not provide a URL for generic search queries.
Expected '{expected}' as Content-Type header but server returned '{actual}'
Expected a 'Content-Type' header field to be returned by the server.
The Atom feed does NOT contain a link to itself that equals the URL of the requested resource. Check the element /atom:feed/atom:link with @rel='self' and the the request URL.

The self link's hreflang attribute is not the same as the xml:lang attribute of the Atom feed or if the xml:lang attribute is not given, hreflang is not the same as the language code defined in the OpenSearch description.

The Atom feed does NOT contain a link to itself with a 'hreflang' attribute that either equals the xml:lang attribute ('/atom:feed/atom:title/@xml:lang') or the OpenSearchDescription language code ('/os:OpenSearchDescription/os:Language[1]').
The Atom feed id '{actual}' element does NOT refer to the self URL '{expected}'.
The Atom feed does NOT contain a link to an OpenSearch Description document.
The OpenSearch Description document link is not an absolute URL.
The Atom feed does NOT contain updated information.
The date must not be in the future.
The date must not be before 2012.
The Feed ID (/atom:feed/atom:id) is not a HTTP URI.
There is at least one feed entry that does not contain exactly one Dataset feed link with attributes rel='alternate' and type='application/atom+xml'.
Missing at least one feed entry with at least one link to a pre-defined dataset file.
Not all linked pre-defined dataset files provide a 'length' attribute. Check if it can be provided.
Missing at least one link to a registry (a /atom:feed/atom:link element with attributes rel='describedby' and type='text/html').
Missing at least one link in an entry to a Dataset metadata record link with attributes rel='describedby' and type='application/xml'.
Missing a link to the metadata record for the download service link with attributes rel='describedby' and type='application/xml' or type='application/vnd.ogc.csw.GetRecordByIdResponse_xml'.
If links with a rel attribute of "section" are provided, then there must be multiple links. So the number of section links must not be exactly 1.

The Dataset Feed does not contain separate entries for each format and CRS combination. Check if either the links belong in one single Dataset feed entry or in another/new separate Dataset Feed. {count} duplicate entries found: {duplicates}
A Dataset Feed shall possess exactly one category per entry. There are {actual} Dataset Feed entries, which possess more than one category. Remove all additional categories.

In a Dataset Feed an entry can possess multiple alternate links but these shall be of the same type. There are {actual} Dataset Feed entries, which alternate links with multiple types. Check if the alternate links belong to another/new Dataset Feed entry.
The Dataset Feed does not contain unique identifier combinations (inspire_dls:spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace and inspire_dls:code).

If the same dataset is available as a WFS 2.0.0 Direct Access Download Service: check that the download service feed includes a link to the WFS Capabilities document with the "rel" attribute set to "related" and the "type" attribute set to "application/xml".

Where a dataset is provided in multiple physical files: a description of the dataset structure must be provided EITHER in an atom "content" element as free text, OR in an external document which is the target of another "link" element. Where a "link" element is used this element shall have a "rel" value equal to "alternate" and a suitable media type shall be used for the "type" value.
There is at least one Feed entry without an inspire_dls:spatial_dataset_identifier_code element.
There is at least one Feed entry without an inspire_dls:spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace element.
The alternate links '{links}' for entries with IDs {ids} offer media types '{types}' that are not in the INSPIRE media type list at http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/media-types/ .
The Response from this Test Step '{testStep}' and the Response from the Test Step are not equal.
Missing at least one INSPIRE example Query ( with a role='example', an inspire_dls:spatial_dataset_identifier_code and an inspire_dls:spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace attribute).
At least one Category in the Dataset feed is not listed in the Download Service Feed.
At least one category for an entry is missing which refers to CRS definition and code.
The ows:OperationsMetadata do not advertize the required conformance class {element}
The fes:Filter_Capabilities do not advertize the required Filter Encoding 2.0 conformance class {element}
Not all alternative language representations of datasets have the required hreflang attribute.
The server experienced a several unexpected error. Please, try again later. if the problem persist, please contact with the helpdesk.
Legend format is invalid. Please, review your code and try again.
Check manually that the provided StoredQuery is sufficiently described with the included parameters.
The recommended identifier 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/operation/download/GetSpatialDataSet' should be used for serving pre-defined Spatial Data Sets.
